title: Midterm Exam Schedule
content:
Dear students,

The midterm exam for Advanced Mathematics will be held on January 15th at 2:00 PM in Room 204. The exam will cover chapters 1-6 from our textbook.

Please bring:
- Calculator
- #2 pencils
- Student ID

Review sessions will be held on January 12th and 13th during regular class hours.

Good luck with your preparation!

Dr. Johnson

title: Lab Safety Reminder
content:
Important reminder about lab safety procedures:

1. Always wear safety goggles when working with chemicals
2. Tie back long hair and avoid loose clothing
3. Report any spills or accidents immediately
4. Never eat or drink in the laboratory
5. Wash hands thoroughly after each lab session

Failure to follow safety protocols will result in removal from lab activities.

Stay safe!
Prof. Smith

title: Field Trip to History Museum
content:
Exciting news! We have arranged a field trip to the National History Museum on February 10th.

Details:
- Departure: 8:00 AM from school parking lot
- Return: 4:00 PM
- Cost: $15 per student (includes transportation and admission)
- Bring: Lunch, water bottle, notebook, and pen

Permission slips must be returned by January 25th. This trip is optional but highly recommended as it relates directly to our current unit on Ancient Civilizations.

Ms. Davis

title: Guest Speaker Next Week
content:
We're honored to have acclaimed author Sarah Mitchell visit our class next Tuesday, January 8th.

Ms. Mitchell will discuss her writing process and the inspiration behind her award-winning novel 'Echoes of Time.' This is a fantastic opportunity to learn from a professional writer.

Please come prepared with thoughtful questions about writing, literature, or her career journey.

Don't miss this unique opportunity!

Mr. Thompson

title: Physics Olympiad Competition
content:
Attention physics enthusiasts!

Registration is now open for the Regional Physics Olympiad competition. This is an excellent opportunity to challenge yourself and compete with students from other schools.

Competition details:
- Date: March 15th
- Location: State University Campus
- Registration deadline: February 1st
- Practice sessions: Every Friday after school starting January 10th

Interested students should see me after class to discuss preparation strategies and register.

Dr. Wilson

title: Programming Contest Announcement
content:
Get ready to code! Our school is participating in the Annual High School Programming Contest.

Contest Information:
- Teams of 3 students
- Problem-solving using Python, Java, or C++
- Date: February 20th
- Prizes for top 3 teams

This is a great chance to apply your programming skills in a competitive environment. Form your teams and let me know by January 15th.

Training sessions will be held every Wednesday after school.

Happy coding!
Ms. Garcia
